title: joker_josue
author: joker_josue
created_time: August 05, 2023, 08:31:56 AMLast edit: August 05, 2023, 08:44:01 AM by joker_josue
content: Liga Portugal 2023/24"Liga Portugal represents the highest tier of professional football in Portugal. It has 18 teams that compete with each other for 34 rounds."by Official siteAfter the success of the topic dedicated to Liga Portugal 2022/23, I decided to open a new topic dedicated to the 2023/24 season.Here we can discuss the performance of the teams in competition, and make our guesses for the games. This topic can be used to talk about Portuguese clubs, both in the Liga Portugal competition, and in other competitions that Portuguese teams participate internally and internationally.List of teams for the 2023/24 season:                                                                                                   Boavista Futebol Clube (Boavista) Casa Pia Atlético Clube (Casa Pia) Estoril Praia (Estoril) Club Football Estrela (Estrela da Amadora) Futebol Clube de Arouca (Arouca) Futebol Clube de Famalicão (Famalicão) Futebol Clube do Porto (Porto) Futebol Clube de Vizela (Vizela) Grupo Desportivo de Chaves (Chaves)Gil Vicente Futebol Clube (Gil Vicente) Moreirense Futebol Clube (Moreirense) Portimonense (Portimonense) Rio Ave Futebol Clube (Rio Ave) Sporting Clube de Braga (Braga) Sporting Clube Farense (Farense) Sport Lisboa e Benfica (Benfica) Sporting Clube de Portugal (Sporting) Vitória Sport Clube (Vit. Guimarães)Good season to all!

comments.author: Nheer
comments.body: For the past 3 seasons now we have seen three different title winners, Benfica, FC Porto and Sporting CP have all been fighting and making the league so competitive. Braga have always shown how good they have been as well even though they only qualified for the champions league playoffs and Sporting CP on the other struggled last season, their performance was inconsistent that they barely made it to the europa league. A team like sporting should fight their way to the champions league, I believe next season they would improve on their performance and challenge for the title. The league is very competitive and interesting and all teams are trying to add more talent to their squad in order to challenge for the trophy. I can’t wait for the season to start and see how the teams perform.  I hope to see Benfica will the league again.

comments.author: Slow death
comments.body: there are only 6 days left for the games to start, the first game of the league will be the game of braga against farmalicao, for this season braga had new players, I speak of Bruma, Rodrigo Zalazar, Vitor Carvalho, Víctor Gómez, Sikou Niakaté, Adrián Marín , Ron Lopez. braga did not spend a lot of money on hiring new players and there were some players that were sold, with that i would say that braga will be fighting to stay in the same position as always, that is they are not fighting for the title, they just want a place in the European competitions. Then we have Sporting, which only made two big signings, Viktor Gyökeres and Trincao. but sporting also lost players with Manuel Ugarte who was sold for 60 million euros to PSGthey also sold Pedro Porro, Tiago Tomás, Arthur Gomes and other players, with these departures sporting made a lot of profit, because they sold players for a high price and bought players for a low price, the problem will be what performance they will present in this new season. in the case of benfica we have 3 new players, we have dimaria, Orkun Kökcü and David Jurasek. there are others, but these for me are the main ones, but benfica also sold playersJulian Weigl, Gilberto, Lucas Veríssimo and soon Gonçalo Ramos. so I see benfica weaker this season, it doesn't surprise me because benfica always does that when they win the leaguewhile porto brought Nico González and Fran Navarro, but some players will also leave, I see that porto will be champions this season, in 4 days we will see a good game in which porto will play against benfica in the super cup, that will give us a little insight into what to expect from these two teams this season

comments.author: Oneandpure
comments.body: Last three season, Portuguese League most competitive with difference team became the winner, season 2020/21 Sporting Lisbon success become the champion and have 5 difference points from FC Porto, next time season 2021/22 FC Porto lead as the winner and having six points left from Sporting Lisbon and last season Benfica success winning domestic league with dramatically and have two points left from FC Porto. Portuguese League is most competitive in Europe because they have two automatically teams qualify to UEFA Champion League and teams who finished on 3rd standings place have play on qualifier.Bad performance from Sporting Lisbon last season after failure finishing on Champion League spot standing and SC Braga will be Portuguese League teams participants in Champion League qualifier.

comments.author: joker_josue
comments.body: Quote from: Slow death on August 05, 2023, 06:25:21 PMthey also sold Pedro Porro, Tiago Tomás, Arthur Gomes and other players, with these departures sporting made a lot of profit, because they sold players for a high price and bought players for a low price, the problem will be what performance they will present in this new season. in the case of benfica we have 3 new players, we have dimaria, Orkun Kökcü and David Jurasek. there are others, but these for me are the main ones, but benfica also sold playersJulian Weigl, Gilberto, Lucas Veríssimo and soon Gonçalo Ramos. so I see benfica weaker this season, it doesn't surprise me because benfica always does that when they win the leaguewhile porto brought Nico González and Fran Navarro, but some players will also leave, I see that porto will be champions this season, in 4 days we will see a good game in which porto will play against benfica in the super cup, that will give us a little insight into what to expect from these two teams this seasonIn reality, only two players left Benfica, who were really important last season: Grimaldo and Gonçalo Ramos. Looking at Benfica's squad, I'd say it's still the strongest in the league. If he's going to win, it's still hard for me to give an opinion, as Porto will play a lot with his "off the field" schemes.When it comes to the Super Cup game, Benfica tend not to play a good game - regardless of the opponent. Therefore, I think it will be difficult to understand who will be better at the start of the season, if Porto or Benfica.On the other hand, the coach has already noticed how the spirit of the squad is when he plays against Porto. And in that sense, I believe that prepare the team in another way.Just a final note about transfers. In Portugal, the only source of income for clubs is the sale of players, so all clubs have to sell players when good offers come up, as they are unable to offer equal wages to other European clubs.

comments.author: joker_josue
comments.created_time: August 07, 2023, 08:36:13 PMLast edit: August 10, 2023, 12:16:14 AM by joker_josue
comments.body: The first game of the season is coming up: Super Cup Porto vs  BenficaThe game takes place on the 9th of August. What are your guesses?

comments.author: borovichok
comments.body: Quote from: joker_josue on August 07, 2023, 08:36:13 PMThe first game of the season is coming up: Super Cup Porto vs  BenficaThe game takes place on the 9th of August. What are your guesses?9th of August is tomorrow, we should expect the very best from both sides. They wouldn't be relenting on the pitch, I've triggered my wager on these teams, probably in favour of Benfica to win because they have the upper hand when it includes players and enhanced performance. Stretching my bones to get full preparation for the Portuguese Super Cup. There's alot to talk about, I will be indoor with my cool Heineken to entertain myself comfortably at home tomorrow night. It's absolutely not a game one would missed for anything, both teams are elite clubs and have the possibility to draw concentration.

comments.author: shogun47
comments.body: Quote from: borovichok on August 08, 2023, 03:28:43 AMQuote from: joker_josue on August 07, 2023, 08:36:13 PMThe first game of the season is coming up: Super Cup Porto vs  BenficaThe game takes place on the 9th of August. What are your guesses?9th of August is tomorrow, we should expect the very best from both sides. They wouldn't be relenting on the pitch, I've triggered my wager on these teams, probably in favour of Benfica to win because they have the upper hand when it includes players and enhanced performance. Stretching my bones to get full preparation for the Portuguese Super Cup. There's alot to talk about, I will be indoor with my cool Heineken to entertain myself comfortably at home tomorrow night. It's absolutely not a game one would missed for anything, both teams are elite clubs and have the possibility to draw concentration.  i would also go with Benfica here. If I am not mistaken the game takes place on neutral grounds and last season I thought for a second that Benfica could have some problems at the end of the season, since Porto kept winning their games. But their was solid until the last day and I believe they have a slight advantage over Porto. But this can really go both ways. There have been hardly any changes in the Porto team, so Benfica knows what they are up against.

comments.author: tusandii
comments.body: Arouca just two days ago added Miguel Puche to their attack line which is positioned on the left wing and with the addition of this attacking player, it feels that Arouca can have a better attacking game this season.Arouca will have their match against Estoril Praia and Miguel Puche looks like he could come right play and make a direct contribution to Arouca's game.In this match I tend to prefer Arouca to bet on because if you look at Arouca can have a more dominant advantage than Estoril Praia. For this season, Arouca has prepared quite well so that they still have a big chance of winning oppose Estoril Praia.

comments.author: execijutiere
comments.body: I think Benfica is the favorite in the Portuguese Super Cup final. When we look at the squads of the two teams, Benfica is better and I can say that it has strengthened its power after the di Maria transfer. Our national team player Orkun Kökçü plays as a defensive midfielder. We can say that it is an important match for both teams to try themselves before the league starts and see if they are strong in terms of performance.

comments.author: rdluffy
comments.body: Thanks for creating the topic joker_josue  Last year was the first year I focused more on the Portuguese league with the bets and I made a very good profitThis year I will again bet on the Portuguese league and I will add another championship to learn better, maybe it will be the Spanish LeagueToday there's a good warm-up to see what's coming this yearThe odds are: Benfica (2.55) x Porto (2.80)As always, balanced and hard to predict, but I think Benfica will win the Super Cup

comments.author: marcous
comments.body: Quote from: joker_josue on August 07, 2023, 08:36:13 PMThe first game of the season is coming up: Super Cup Porto vs  BenficaThe game takes place on the 9th of August. What are your guesses?In head to head, Porto is superior on paper from Benfica. The last five meetings between the two teams have shown that Porto have won more matches, namely four times and Benfica only once. But it's difficult to predict the final, because usually the final always presents a balanced spectacle, I mean both teams will play more carefully and not be dominant in attack.

comments.author: joker_josue
comments.body: Quote from: rdluffy on August 09, 2023, 01:28:24 PMThanks for creating the topic joker_josue  Last year was the first year I focused more on the Portuguese league with the bets and I made a very good profitSo stay tuned to the topic, I'm preparing some interesting things.Not only in the graphical aspect, but in the information presented.

comments.author: LTU_btc
comments.body: Quote from: execijutiere on August 09, 2023, 12:37:30 PMI think Benfica is the favorite in the Portuguese Super Cup final. When we look at the squads of the two teams, Benfica is better and I can say that it has strengthened its power after the di Maria transfer. Our national team player Orkun Kökçü plays as a defensive midfielder. We can say that it is an important match for both teams to try themselves before the league starts and see if they are strong in terms of performance.I wouldn't say that they're favorites, it's difficult to call favorite in this game, after all, it's first official game for both teams. Bookmakers also don't have favorite.I would like to see high scoring game, but I was burned a bit with such kind of bets in recent supercups like Belgian or Community Shield, so, 0:0 wouldn't be surprising too.

comments.author: Ulven
comments.body: Quote from: LTU_btc on August 09, 2023, 07:28:59 PMQuote from: execijutiere on August 09, 2023, 12:37:30 PMI think Benfica is the favorite in the Portuguese Super Cup final. When we look at the squads of the two teams, Benfica is better and I can say that it has strengthened its power after the di Maria transfer. Our national team player Orkun Kökçü plays as a defensive midfielder. We can say that it is an important match for both teams to try themselves before the league starts and see if they are strong in terms of performance.I wouldn't say that they're favorites, it's difficult to call favorite in this game, after all, it's first official game for both teams. Bookmakers also don't have favorite.I would like to see high scoring game, but I was burned a bit with such kind of bets in recent supercups like Belgian or Community Shield, so, 0:0 wouldn't be surprising too.It sounds like you're looking forward to an exciting match between two teams playing their first official game. Betting on high-scoring games can be unpredictable, especially considering recent results. A 0:0 scoreline wouldn't be too surprising either. Enjoy the match!!!I believe both teams will score in the second half of the match, and I wouldn't like to see a draw result. My bet today was in favor of Benfica.

comments.author: Slow death
comments.body: Quote from: joker_josue on August 07, 2023, 08:36:13 PMThe first game of the season is coming up: Super Cup Porto vs  BenficaThe game takes place on the 9th of August. What are your guesses?If I had posted to answer this question before the game started I wouldn't hesitate to say that the port would win, since the benfica when playing with the port has a tendency to play badly and lose the game, but the game is already over and the porto lost and the most unbelievable thing about it all was seeing porto not being able to score at least 1 goal, as expected in porto games, in this game there was also a red card, this time the red card went to the porto player, something I found strange because in most cases porto wins games based on the advantage that the referees have given them, porto team had chances to score but they wasted and benfica is taking advantage of the opportunities they hadIt's funny that there was a move in which the player from Porto touched the ball with his hand but the referee simply ignored it and in the minutes that followed, Benfica scored a goal. I see that in this game the referee was not in favor of Porto, at least in this game, we'll see when the league games start and Porto starts playing if the referee won't be helping Porto to win the games because if Porto doesn't have help from the referees and with this squad and coach, then porto will have a lot of difficulties to win the league with the big difference in points they like to have when they become champions, porto's first game will be against moreirense, it will be very interesting to see how the port and the referees will leave, with that I will start to see if the port will be champion or not

comments.author: joker_josue
comments.body: The winner of the first despot cup in Portugal is already known: BENFICA.Here are the data:SUPER CUP - RESULTS: Benfica 2-0  PortoFEATURED MATCH - STATISTICS: Benfica 2-0  Porto53% Ball possession 47%15 Goal attempts 127 Goal kick 28 Kick out 1019 Free kick 217 Corner kick 42 Offside 124 Touch line 262 Goalkeeper defenses 520 Fouls 190 Red cards 17 Yellow cards 5126 Attacks 10975 Dangerous Attacks 54

comments.author: LTU_btc
comments.body: Super Cup final was interesting, especially some last minutes of game. Benfica were up 2:0 and when Pepe got red card, it looked that's the for Porto. Just few moments later Galeno scored fantastic goal, but it was cancelled because there was handball in early phase of attack. I was disappointed about it because that goal would made last minutes of game very exciting, but rules are rules.

comments.author: rdluffy
comments.body: Quote from: joker_josue on August 09, 2023, 07:00:18 PMSo stay tuned to the topic, I'm preparing some interesting things.Not only in the graphical aspect, but in the information presented.  Nice to know that, I imagine it will be beaultiful tables  Quote from: Slow death on August 09, 2023, 11:57:20 PMIf I had posted to answer this question before the game started I wouldn't hesitate to say that the port would win...That was my initial thought too, Porto usually do well when they play against BenficaBut I analyzed it better and thought that Benfica had full conditions to win the game, and I got it right hehehe.It was a good start for Benfica and a good start for my bets  I watched the match, and caught my attention the high number of cards during the game, there were 12 yellow cards and 1 red card with the total of 40 foulsI don't know if it was due to the referee preferring to conduct the game that way or if it could be a trend for the Portuguese championship to punish fouls more

comments.author: joker_josue
comments.body: Quote from: rdluffy on August 10, 2023, 09:31:16 PMNice to know that, I imagine it will be beaultiful tables  Yes, lots of statistical data, and maybe other information. I don't know, I still have several options open.For now, you can have an idea of how it will be, based on the post where I indicate the result of the Super Cup.Every week, I will bring the stats of at least one game.What other data do you think could be interesting to present?Quote from: rdluffy on August 10, 2023, 09:31:16 PMI watched the match, and caught my attention the high number of cards during the game, there were 12 yellow cards and 1 red card with the total of 40 foulsI don't know if it was due to the referee preferring to conduct the game that way or if it could be a trend for the Portuguese championship to punish fouls moreReferees in Portugal, in general, are very weak. Just to give you an idea, it is rare for Portuguese referees to referee Champions League matches, or a World Cup.This referee is known for giving a lot of yellows. And he started giving yellows in bids without any sense. Hence having this huge amount of yellow.I really hope this doesn't become a trend this season.This weekend, the championship begins. Follow the games of the first round. What are your guesses?MATCH DAY  1:11.08. 20:15  Braga vs  Famalicão12.08. 15:30  Gil Vicente vs  Portimonense12.08. 18:00  Farense vs  Casa Pia12.08. 20:30  Sporting vs  Vizela13.08. 15:30  Rio Ave vs  Chaves13.08. 18:00  Estrela Amadora vs  Vit. Guimarães13.08. 20:30  Arouca vs  Estoril14.08. 18:45  Moreirense vs  Porto14.08. 20:45  Boavista vs  BenficaInfo: day.month. time (Lisbon time)
